data.value: MINRES minimizes norm(Ax - b) for a real symmetric matrix A.  Unlike the Conjugate Gradient method, A can be indefinite or singular.
If shift != 0 then the method solves (A - shift*I)x = b
Value to apply to the system
Tolerance to achieve. The algorithm terminates when the relative residual is below
Maximum number of iterations.  Iteration will stop after maxiter steps even if the specified tolerance has not been achieved.

Preconditioner for A.  The preconditioner should approximate the inverse of A.  Effective preconditioning dramatically improves the rate of convergence, which implies that fewer iterations are needed to reach a given error tolerance.
User-supplied function to call after each iteration.  It is called as callback(xk), where xk is the current solution vector.
, print out a summary and metrics related to the solution during iterations. Default is
, run additional input validation to check that
The real symmetric N-by-N matrix of the linear system Alternatively,
can be a linear operator which can produce
Right hand side of the linear system. Has shape (N,) or (N,1).
Use MINimum RESidual iteration to solve Ax=b

signature.value: minres(A, b, x0=None, shift=0.0, tol=1e-05, maxiter=None, M=None, callback=None, show=False, check=False)
